snippet: Christine Lagarde, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, has become as influential as a head of state in Europe, causing controversy both inside and outside the region.
abstract: International Monetary Fund and its managing director Christine Lagarde have acquired enormous stature in Europe as a result of the euro crisis; fact that the organization is so tangled in European affairs is controversial both inside and outside the Continent, and could be source of discord as the IMF and World Bank hold their spring meetings in Washington.
lead_paragraph: Christine Lagarde, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, has become as influential as a head of state in Europe, causing controversy both inside and outside the region.

headline.seo: Euro Zone Crisis Has Increased I.M.F.’s Power
headline.main: Euro Zone Crisis Has Increased I.M.F.’s Power
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Rides the Euro Zone Crisis to New Heights of Influence
